CVE-2012-4558.summary: Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in the balancer_handler function in the manager interface in mod_proxy_balancer.c in the mod_proxy_balancer module in the Apache HTTP Server 2.2.x before 2.2.24-dev and 2.4.x before 2.4.4 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via a crafted string.

CVE-2013-1896.summary: mod_dav.c in the Apache HTTP Server before 2.2.25 does not properly determine whether DAV is enabled for a URI, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault) via a MERGE request in which the URI is configured for handling by the mod_dav_svn module, but a certain href attribute in XML data refers to a non-DAV URI.

CVE-2012-3499.summary: Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in the Apache HTTP Server 2.2.x before 2.2.24-dev and 2.4.x before 2.4.4 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via vectors involving hostnames and URIs in the (1) mod_imagemap, (2) mod_info, (3) mod_ldap, (4) mod_proxy_ftp, and (5) mod_status modules.

CVE-2014-0231.summary: The mod_cgid module in the Apache HTTP Server before 2.4.10 does not have a timeout mechanism, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (process hang) via a request to a CGI script that does not read from its stdin file descriptor.

CVE-2017-7679.summary: In Apache httpd 2.2.x before 2.2.33 and 2.4.x before 2.4.26, mod_mime can read one byte past the end of a buffer when sending a malicious Content-Type response header.

CVE-2013-2249.summary: mod_session_dbd.c in the mod_session_dbd module in the Apache HTTP Server before 2.4.5 proceeds with save operations for a session without considering the dirty flag and the requirement for a new session ID, which has unspecified impact and remote attack vectors.

CVE-2016-4975.summary: Possible CRLF injection allowing HTTP response splitting attacks for sites which use mod_userdir. This issue was mitigated by changes made in 2.4.25 and 2.2.32 which prohibit CR or LF injection into the "Location" or other outbound header key or value. Fixed in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.25 (Affected 2.4.1-2.4.23). Fixed in Apache HTTP Server 2.2.32 (Affected 2.2.0-2.2.31).

CVE-2013-5704.summary: The mod_headers module in the Apache HTTP Server 2.2.22 allows remote attackers to bypass "RequestHeader unset" directives by placing a header in the trailer portion of data sent with chunked transfer coding.  NOTE: the vendor states "this is not a security issue in httpd as such."

CVE-2017-7668.summary: The HTTP strict parsing changes added in Apache httpd 2.2.32 and 2.4.24 introduced a bug in token list parsing, which allows ap_find_token() to search past the end of its input string. By maliciously crafting a sequence of request headers, an attacker may be able to cause a segmentation fault, or to force ap_find_token() to return an incorrect value.

CVE-2017-3167.summary: In Apache httpd 2.2.x before 2.2.33 and 2.4.x before 2.4.26, use of the ap_get_basic_auth_pw() by third-party modules outside of the authentication phase may lead to authentication requirements being bypassed.

CVE-2013-6438.summary: The dav_xml_get_cdata function in main/util.c in the mod_dav module in the Apache HTTP Server before 2.4.8 does not properly remove whitespace characters from CDATA sections, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (daemon crash) via a crafted DAV WRITE request.

CVE-2012-2687.summary: Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in the make_variant_list function in mod_negotiation.c in the mod_negotiation module in the Apache HTTP Server 2.4.x before 2.4.3, when the MultiViews option is enabled, allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via a crafted filename that is not properly handled during construction of a variant list.

CVE-2017-3169.summary: In Apache httpd 2.2.x before 2.2.33 and 2.4.x before 2.4.26, mod_ssl may dereference a NULL pointer when third-party modules call ap_hook_process_connection() during an HTTP request to an HTTPS port.

CVE-2014-0098.summary: The log_cookie function in mod_log_config.c in the mod_log_config module in the Apache HTTP Server before 2.4.8 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault and daemon crash) via a crafted cookie that is not properly handled during truncation.

CVE-2013-1862.summary: mod_rewrite.c in the mod_rewrite module in the Apache HTTP Server 2.2.x before 2.2.25 writes data to a log file without sanitizing non-printable characters, which might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via an HTTP request containing an escape sequence for a terminal emulator.

CVE-2016-8612.summary: Apache HTTP Server mod_cluster before version httpd 2.4.23 is vulnerable to an Improper Input Validation in the protocol parsing logic in the load balancer resulting in a Segmentation Fault in the serving httpd process.

<section id="feature_a">
	<div class="layout-center clearfix">
		  <div class="region region-feature-a block-count--4">
    <div class="block block-views col-sm-6 panel contextual-links-region first odd" id="block-views-latest-news-block-1">

        <h2 class="block__title">Highlights in Corrections</h2>
    
  <div class="view view-latest-news view-id-latest_news view-display-id-block_1 view-dom-id-35dd9f08c405c714f1db38f5a4b47d21">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first training-news">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-field-news-date">        <div class="field-content"></div>  </div>  
  <span class="views-field views-field-title">        <h3 class="field-content"><a href="/news-media/media-releases/improving-outcomes-justice-involved-vets-ptsd-panel-discussion"> Improving Outcomes for Justice-Involved Vets with PTSD: a panel discussion</a></h3>  </span>  
  <span class="views-field views-field-body">        <span class="field-content"><p><span style="font-size:small"><span style="color:#39364f"><span style="font-family:"Neue Plak", serif"><span style="letter-spacing:0.533333px"><span style="background-color:#ffffff">In collaboration with the Veterans History Project, the National Institute of Corrections will host a panel discussion in anticipation of PTSD Awareness month on May 15, 2019 at the Library of Congress. </span></span></span></span></span></p>
</span>  </span>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-2 views-row-even training-news">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-field-news-date">        <div class="field-content"></div>  </div>  
  <span class="views-field views-field-title">        <h3 class="field-content"><a href="/news-media/media-releases/cooperative-agreement-documenting-and-developing-two-leadership-curriculum">Cooperative Agreement - Documenting and Developing Two Leadership Curriculum Packages</a></h3>  </span>  
  <span class="views-field views-field-body">        <span class="field-content"><p>The National Institute of Corrections (NIC) is seeking applications for funding under the Fiscal Year 2019.  Work under this cooperative agreement involves the documenting and developing of two curriculum packages: NIC’s Correctional Leadership Development (CLD) and Management Development for the Future (MDF).</p>
</span>  </span>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-3 views-row-odd training-news">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-field-news-date">        <div class="field-content"></div>  </div>  
  <span class="views-field views-field-title">        <h3 class="field-content"><a href="/news-media/media-releases/call-nic-technical-resource-providers">Call for NIC Technical Resource Providers </a></h3>  </span>  
  <span class="views-field views-field-body">        <span class="field-content"><p><span style="font-size:12.0pt"><span style="line-height:107%"><span style="font-family:"Times New Roman",serif">NIC is conducting market research and seeks individuals with demonstrated experience in successful facilitation of, or acting for, corrections based Crisis Intervention Teams Training. <i>Responding to this information request does not constitute any binding agreement between the respondent and the United States Government</i>.</span></span></span></p>
</span>  </span>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-4 views-row-even training-news">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-field-news-date">        <div class="field-content"></div>  </div>  
  <span class="views-field views-field-title">        <h3 class="field-content"><a href="/news-media/media-releases/you-can-t-read-label-inside-jar-disruptive-truth-bombs-about-criminology">You Can’t Read the Label from Inside the Jar: Disruptive Truth Bombs about Criminology, Implementation Science, and Real-World Organizational Change</a></h3>  </span>  
  <span class="views-field views-field-body">        <span class="field-content"><p>This presentation will provide the 'real talk' necessary to think critically about the truths, lies, twists, and real-world trials about criminology, implementation science, and organizational change.</p>
</span>  </span>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-5 views-row-odd training-news">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-field-news-date">        <div class="field-content"></div>  </div>  
  <span class="views-field views-field-title">        <h3 class="field-content"><a href="/news-media/media-releases/bja-seeking-applications-implementing-prea-standards-protecting-inmates">BJA Seeking Applications – Implementing the PREA Standards, Protecting Inmates and Safeguarding Communities</a></h3>  </span>  
  <span class="views-field views-field-body">        <span class="field-content"><p>Through the <a href="https://www.bja.gov/funding/prea19.pdf" target="_blank">FY 2019 Implementing the PREA Standards, Protecting Inmates, and Safeguarding Communities </a>opportunity, BJA is seeking applications for funding of projects designed to prevent, detect, and respond to sexual abuse and sexual harassment in confinement facilities, and to achieve and maintain compliance with the Prison Rape Elimination Act (PREA) standards. Apply by: May 22, 2019.</p>
</span>  </span>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-6 views-row-even views-row-last training-news">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-field-news-date">        <div class="field-content"></div>  </div>  
  <span class="views-field views-field-title">        <h3 class="field-content"><a href="/news-media/media-releases/cooperative-agreement-alabama-department-corrections-thinking-change"> Cooperative Agreement - Alabama Department of Corrections Thinking for a Change Overview Training Project</a></h3>  </span>  
  <span class="views-field views-field-body">        <span class="field-content"><p>The National Institute of Corrections (NIC) is seeking applications for funding under the Fiscal Year 2019 for the Alabama Department of Corrections Thinking for a Change Overview Training Project. This project furthers NIC’s mission by building capacity of state and local correctional agencies to develop and establish effective inmate cognitive behavioral rehabilitation interventions and strategies</p>
</span>  </span>  </div>
    </div>
  
  
  
  
      <div class="view-footer">
      <p class=""> <a class="button button-purple bright" href="https://public.govdelivery.com/accounts/USDOJBOPNIC/subscriber/new">Subscribe to News Alerts</a> <a class="button button-green pull-right" href="/news-media/media-releases">View Latest News</a></p>
    </div>
  
  
</div>
</div>

        <h2 class="block__title">NIC in the News</h2>
    
  <div class="view view-latest-news view-id-latest_news view-display-id-block_2 panel-body view-dom-id-5b7ea5b5b8449a9f22c8cb5e929c6807">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first training-news">
      
          <span class="article-author-date"><span class="date-display-single" property="dc:date" datatype="xsd:dateTime" content="2019-02-14T14:45:00-07:00">14 Feb 2019</span></span>    
  <span class="views-field views-field-title">        <h6 class="field-content margin0"><a href="https://www.houstonpublicmedia.org/articles/news/2019/02/14/321838/sheriffs-office-will-make-harris-county-jail-more-child-friendly/">NIC in Houston assisting Harris County Jail with child-friendly visitation</a></h6>  </span>  
  <span class="views-field views-field-body">        <span class="field-content"><p>Experts from the <strong>National Institute of Corrections</strong> visited Houston as part of an initiative to make the Harris County jail more child-friendly.</p>
</span>  </span>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-2 views-row-even training-news">
      
          <span class="article-author-date"><span class="date-display-single" property="dc:date" datatype="xsd:dateTime" content="2019-02-06T09:00:00-07:00">6 Feb 2019</span></span>    
  <span class="views-field views-field-title">        <h6 class="field-content margin0"><a href="http://indianacourts.us/times/2019/01/pretrial-part2/">Indiana's Evidence Based Decision Making Initiatives have measurable results, receive ongoing technical assistance from NIC</a></h6>  </span>  
  <span class="views-field views-field-body">        <span class="field-content"></span>  </span>  </div>
  <div class="views-row views-row-3 views-row-odd views-row-last training-news">
      
          <span class="article-author-date"><span class="date-display-single" property="dc:date" datatype="xsd:dateTime" content="2019-01-25T08:00:00-07:00">25 Jan 2019</span></span>    
  <span class="views-field views-field-title">        <h6 class="field-content margin0"><a href="https://www.tennessean.com/story/news/politics/2019/01/25/tennessee-open-its-first-housing-units-military-veteran-inmates/2677829002/">Tennessee opens first housing units dedicated to justice involved veterans.</a></h6>  </span>  
  <span class="views-field views-field-body">        <span class="field-content"><p>"Veterans will be put together to get into a more common structure. It's veterans, they're going to get through this together," said Rogers, newly appointed by Gov. Bill Lee to lead veteran services. ... Tennessee's veteran housing program follows a national trend of "barracks behind bars." Inmates can work through problems they often share, such as substance abuse and post-traumatic stress disorder.</p>
</span>  </span>  </div>
    </div>

<section id="feature_b">
	<div class="layout-center clearfix">
		  <div class="region region-feature-b block-count--1">
    <div class="block block-views contextual-links-region first last odd" id="block-views-events-block-1">

        <h2 class="block__title">NIC Events</h2>
    
  <div class="view view-events view-id-events view-display-id-block_1 view-dom-id-9217bbf596728eeaf4b4d978f8b5d1b3">
        
  
  
      <div class="view-content">
        <h3>Feb 2019</h3>
  <div class="views-row views-row-1 views-row-odd views-row-first views-row-last">
      
  <div class="views-field views-field-field-feature-image">        <div class="field-content"><a href="/news-media/events/leadership-development-mid-level-managers-vilt-series"><img typeof="foaf:Image" src="https://173.164.54.217/sites/default/files/images/events/computer-guy-with-headphones_0.jpg" width="250" height="228" alt="young man working on a computer" /></a></div>  </div>  
  <h5 class="views-field views-field-title">        <span class="field-content"><a href="/news-media/events/leadership-development-mid-level-managers-vilt-series">Leadership Development for Mid-Level Managers VILT Series</a></span>  </h5>  
  <span class="views-field views-field-field-event-date-1">        <span class="field-content">Wednesday 27th February at 10:00am - Wednesday 1st May at 12:00pm</span>  </span>  
  <span class="views-field views-field-body">        <span class="field-content"><p>Are you interested in growing and enhancing your leadership ability within your agency? Do you want to continue your leadership growth by taking a look at yourself via a 360º assessment and charting a course for your further development based on your strengths and challenges? Then come and join NIC for this interactive five (5) part Virtual Instructor Led (VILT) training! Each VILT is up to 1.5 hours in length, with time for you to apply your leadership learnings in between each session. [ <strong>Enrollment</strong> <strong>Deadline</strong>: January 25, 2019]</p>
</span>  </span>  </div>
  <h3>May 2019</h3>

    		<div class="field-item even  "  property="content:encoded">
			<span><p>Managing inmate behavior is the core function of jails. Historically, jails have emphasized the physical containment of inmates over actively supervising them and managing their behavior. 			<span><h6>Prisons Division</h6></span>
		</div>
      </div>
</div>
<div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
    		<div class="field-item even  "  property="content:encoded">
			<span><p>The Prisons Division facilitates specialized training related to prison operations, conducts operational networks, coordinates technical assistance, as well as programs regarding leadership and management.</p>
</span>
		</div>
      </div>
</div>
</a>      </div>
</div>

		</div>

<div class="field field-name-title field-type-ds field-label-hidden">

		</div>
      </div>
</div>
<div class="field field-name-body field-type-text-with-summary field-label-hidden">
    <div class="field-items">
    		<div class="field-item even  "  property="content:encoded">
			<span><p>The NIC Jails Division's services include training, networks, technical assistance, and information resources, such as documents and DVDs. These services are conducted under four initiatives.</p>

</div>
